net.derquinse.common.i18n

Interface Localized<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Localized object type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Function<Locale,T>, Supplier<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLocalized, BundleLocalized, ForwardingLocalized, LocalizedMessage, Unlocalized

    public interface Localized<T>
extends Supplier<T>, Function<Locale,T>
    Generic interface for localized objects. Target objects must be non-null. If a localized object is optional, it is the "Localized" reference the one that must be null, and not the target object.
    Author:
    Andres Rodriguez

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T apply(Locale locale)
      Returns the object for the specified locale.
      T get()
      Returns the default value for the localized object.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.google.common.base.Function

        equals

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        T apply(@Nullable
      Locale locale)
        Returns the object for the specified locale. If no value for the specified locale is found or the argument is null, the default value must be returned. The returned value must be non-null.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface Function<Locale,T>
        Parameters:
        locale - The requested locale.
        Returns:
        The localized object.
        Throws:
        UnableToLocalizeException - if an error occurs.

      • get

        T get()
        Returns the default value for the localized object. The returned value must be non-null. Note that the default value may not be the value for the systems default locale.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Supplier<T>
        Returns:
        The localized object's default value.
        Throws:
        UnableToLocalizeException - if an error occurs.
